title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Celtics' bench played a crucial role in their 111-107 victory over the Magic, evening the two-game series.
Luka Garza scored 16 points in 17 minutes, with 12 points in the fourth quarter, providing key rebounds and scoring.
Anfernee Simons contributed a game-high 25 points, including a 14-point run in the second quarter, sparking the Celtics' offense.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek re-signed with the Boston Red Sox for the 2026 season as the game-planning and run prevention coach.
Varitek, a former Red Sox catcher, has been with the franchise for nearly 30 years, including roles in coaching since 2017.
Varitek cited team familiarity and roster potential, highlighting catcher Carlos Narvaez's promising development, as reasons for staying.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson combined for three touchdowns in a win over Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Williams scored his first career touchdown with a 71-yard play; Henderson added two scores, including a 69-yard run.
Rookies Will Campbell and Jared Wilson excelled in pass protection, while Craig Woodson and Elijah Ponder made key defensive plays.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye, New England Patriots QB, leads NFL MVP odds at +250 according to FanDuel and DraftKings.
Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
This season, Maye has completed 71.7% of passes for 2,555 yards, 19 touchdowns, and five interceptions.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski to sign a one-day contract with New England Patriots to retire as a Patriot.
Gronkowski spent nine seasons with the Patriots, winning three Super Bowls, before joining Tampa Bay.
He ranks third in NFL history for tight end receiving touchdowns with 92 and is a four-time All-Pro.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams led the Patriots' offense, contributing crucial touchdowns in a 28-23 victory over Tampa Bay.
Linebacker Elijah Ponder recorded his first career sack, showcasing persistence in a key fourth-quarter play against Baker Mayfield.
Patriots' tight ends struggled offensively, with Austin Hooper and Hunter Henry failing to make significant contributions in the game.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots extend winning streak to seven games with a 28-23 victory over Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams score three touchdowns, contributing significantly to New England's win.
Quarterback Drake Maye throws for 270 yards and two touchdowns despite a critical fourth-quarter interception.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police Officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, was arrested for DUI after crashing his car into a pole on Oct. 19.
Daveiga reportedly drove onto the sidewalk at Leverett Circle, failing to stop or yield, and was found with slurred speech.
He pleaded not guilty in Charlestown Court, was released on personal recognizance, and is due back in court Dec. 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees with work permits remain in federal custody after a Nov. 4 ICE raid.
ICE agents allegedly detained the workers without allowing them to retrieve documents or fully identify themselves.
Attorney reports mistreatment allegations and filed orders to prevent workers' transfers, with some taken to Texas.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Comedian Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on November 8, 2025, marking the fifth episode of the 51st season.
Musical guest Sombr performed during the episode, which also featured Pete Davidson's return to the 'Weekend Update' segment.
Nikki Glaser's rise to fame began in 2024 with her participation in high-profile roasts, leading to hosting major events like the Golden Globes.
